item.title: OKBench: Democratizing LLM Evaluation with Fully Automated, On-Demand, Open Knowledge Benchmarking
item.description: arXiv:2511.08598v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Knowledge-intensive question answering is central to large language models (LLMs) and is typically assessed using static benchmarks derived from sources like Wikipedia and textbooks. However, these benchmarks fail to capture evolving knowledge in a dy...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> model, API, large language model, LLM, augmented | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation of Pediatric Speech-Language Pathology vignettes: A Proof-of-Concept Study
item.description: arXiv:2511.08600v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Clinical vignettes are essential educational tools in speech-language pathology (SLP), but manual creation is time-intensive. item.title: Think Before You Retrieve: Learning Test-Time Adaptive Search with Small Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2511.07581v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Effective information retrieval requires reasoning over partial evidence and refining strategies as information emerges. Yet current approaches fall short: neural retrievers lack reasoning capabilities, large language models (LLMs) provide semantic de...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> fine-tuning, model, RAG, reasoning, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Beyond Fact Retrieval: Episodic Memory for RAG with Generative Semantic Workspaces
item.description: arXiv:2511.07587v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) face fundamental challenges in long-context reasoning: many documents exceed their finite context windows, while performance on texts that do fit degrades with sequence length, necessitating their augmentation with externa...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> context window, model, memory, embedding, RAG | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> knowledge base, model, vector, RAG, reasoning | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
